example[0]: From where we stood, the ground fell away sharply to the valley floor.
definition[1]: to become separated from something after being fixed to it
example[1]: The paint was falling away in patches.
definition[2]: if a feeling falls away, you stop having it, usually suddenly
example[2]: The view from the top was wonderful and our tiredness fell away.
example[3]: Demand for our more theoretical courses has fallen away.
example[4]: Dealers said activity in equities had fallen away sharply last week.
definition[5]: to lose in a competitive situation
example[5]: After the weak carriers fall away, American, Delta, and UAL will be the dominant airlines.
